definition: delicacy and fine taste (idiom); a wonderful treat
delicacy and fine taste (idiom); a wonderful treat

sentences.english: Even white truffles , the prized culinary delicacy, could not escape the slump.
sentences.chinese: 即便是食中珍馐松露也难逃贬值的命运。

sentences.english: And costly delicacies on jade platters.
Pangolins are popular fare at restaurants in China.
sentences.chinese: 穿山甲在中国是极受欢迎的珍馐。

sentences.english: Limpid wine in golden goblets worth ten thousand coppers a bushel; Dainty food on jade plates cost a myriad coins.
sentences.chinese: 金樽清酒斗十千，玉盘珍馐值万钱。

definition: delicacy and fine taste (idiom); a wonderful treat
delicacy and fine taste (idiom); a wonderful treat
exotic delicacies/luxury foodstuff from distant locations
rarities from the mountain and the sea (idiom); fig. a sumptuous spread of food delicacies
the Manchu Han imperial feast, a legendary banquet in the Qing dynasty/(fig.) a sumptuous banquet
bejeweled nectar (idiom); ambrosia of the immortals/superb liquor/top quality wine
great meal fit for dragon's son (idiom); sumptuous banquet
